p: Dengue viral infection is a major threat to global health. Numbers of reported cases across the Americas, Southeast Asia, and the western Pacific exceeded 1.2 million in 2008 and 3 million in 2013 ( 1, 2). Dengue notifications have been likened to the tip of an iceberg, however, as there are many more infections than reported, because of asymptomatic infections and infections that are misdiagnosed or for which medical attention is not sought ( 3).
